instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.A1425: What is A1425? A1425 is a model number for a 13 inch size MacBook Pro Retina from years Early 2013, Late 2012 with EMC 2672, that may contain one of these boards depending on the year & configuration: 820-3190, 820-3462..
definitions.820-3462: What is 820-3462? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1425</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> 2012 <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3462</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>, graphic issue and freeze
threads.message:
Hello,

Here is board which looks fine, no water damage, but it has issues when displaying some graphics, or colors are not good, and later it freezes.

See photos attached. It is able to run partly Heaven test, but look at the image...

What can be the issue here?

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1425</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> 2012 <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3462</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>, graphic issue and freeze
threads.message:
Try external monitor,
If same, then RAM, or CPU issue...

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1425</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> 2012 <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3462</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>, graphic issue and freeze
threads.message:
Same issues on external monitor.
When running ASD sometimes it freezes also, but I managed to get the attached photos. It says errors, but the images are well displayed curiously
So it is a video controller issue? This is the CPU? No way to try to reflow the RAM?

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1425</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> 2012 <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3462</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>, graphic issue and freeze
threads.message:
Error messages are directly related with CPU.
Nothing to lose heating CPU and RAM.
Just tell to the client, board can get completely dead...
